item.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Release
item.description: - The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom is now available exclusively on Nintendo Switch, featuring new abilities and expansive landscapes for players to explore.

item.title: Implement DNS in a Weekend
item.description: - A DNS resolver is a program that finds the IP address for a domain.

item.title: The .zip TLD sucks
item.description: - Google has made a mistake by allowing people to purchase domain names with .zip and .mov extensions, which can confuse users who click on them thinking they are file names.

item.title: Toyota: Car location data & videos of 2M customers exposed for ten years
item.description: - Toyota Motor Corporation experienced a data breach that exposed the car location information of 2.15 million customers for 10 years.

item.title: Linda Yaccarino is the new CEO of Twitter
item.description: - Elon Musk announces Linda Yaccarino as new CEO of Twitter - Yaccarino to focus on business operations, Musk on product design and new technology - Twitter to be transformed into "X," an everything app

item.title: Morris Tanenbaum, inventor of the silicon transistor, has died
item.description: - Morris Tanenbaum, the inventor of the silicon transistor, has passed away at the age of 94.

item.title: GitHub Copilot Chat Leaked Prompt
item.description: - Microsoft releases early beta of GitHub Copilot Chat - Copilot Chat has a set of confidential rules governing its behavior and interactions - Rules include providing informative responses, adhering to technical information, and avoiding controversial discussions

item.title: Windmill: Open-source developer platform to turn scripts into workflows & UIs
item.description: - Windmill is an open-source developer infrastructure for internal tools that can turn scripts into workflows and UIs through its autogenerated frontend.

item.title: Pigz: Parallel gzip for modern multi-processor, multi-core machines
item.description: - Pigz is a parallel implementation of gzip that utilizes multiple processors and cores to compress data efficiently.

item.title: FUTO â€“ An independent software lab & grant fund
item.description: - FUTO is an independent software lab and grant/investment fund dedicated to developing open-source software and advocating for user, creator, and business control of computing.
